parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate.  It discusses the Constitutional Court (CCR) and its actions regarding election-related rulings, but doesn't endorse or criticize any particular candidate participating in the parliamentary elections.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is published on a public Facebook page ("Comunitatea Liberală 1848") with a paid promotion, clearly intending to reach a wide audience. The content is not a private message or personal communication.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. While the post touches upon a topic related to elections (CCR's role in ensuring fair elections), its primary objective is not to influence voters to choose a specific candidate. The post criticizes the CCR's actions, suggesting a breach of law, but doesn't advocate for or against any particular candidate or party in the parliamentary elections.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post presents information and an opinion on the CCR's actions, resembling a news article or opinion piece. It includes a link to a website article that likely provides more detailed information. While it expresses a critical opinion, it doesn't directly call for voters to support or reject any candidate.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. While the post expresses a strong opinion about the CCR's actions, it's presented as an analysis of events and a critique of the institution's conduct, not as a personal opinion unrelated to the electoral process. The opinion is clearly linked to the functioning of the electoral system.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>471883335845113</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while discussing a topic related to elections (the CCR's role), does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  The post criticizes the CCR's actions, but doesn't promote or discourage voting for any specific candidate or party in the parliamentary elections.  It resembles a news article or opinion piece, focusing on the legal and institutional aspects of the electoral process rather than directly influencing voter choices. The paid promotion increases visibility but doesn't automatically transform the content into electoral propaganda. The lack of any direct reference to specific candidates or parties further supports this conclusion.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Comunitatea Liberală 1848</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
